experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
experience.description: Supported the development of internal data automation systems used to validate clinical trial datasets and ensure compliance with biomedical standards.
highlights: Designed and implemented automated CSV validation/export pipelines using Polars and Python.
Contributed to backend data integration logic for domain validation in Flask.
Created React components for analytics dashboards visualizing processed clinical data.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
experience.description: Developed AI-powered cooking systems for next-generation smart ovens, combining on-device inference, adaptive learning pipelines, and embedded database systems.
highlights: Established a mature end-to-end local database using Room (SQLite) to enable dynamic data storage and adaptive model learning.
Designed and deployed production-grade inference APIs integrating a food recognition model directly into retail-ready smart ovens.
Built a complete adaptive data pipeline that supports continuous model improvement from consumer feedback within connected homes.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
experience.description: Supported development of AI-assisted camera-based detection systems for next-gen appliance diagnostics with an emphasis on early-stage computer vision models.
highlights: Developed computer vision algorithms to accurately detect camera obstructions in KitchenAid ovens.
Deployed an internal support tool for rack-level detection, notably improving the performance of oven ML models.
Executed real-time testing on an oven featuring my algorithms for on-product validation, yielding 94% accuracy.

projects.name: Rapid Ride
description: Utilized digital twin technology to test a virtual scooter program and assess environmental impacts.
Secured first place for best pitch and program at VinUniversity’s competition.
Created visualization results using interactive map-based data displays to show air and traffic improvements.

projects.name: Health Reflect
description: Implemented an intelligent mirror to monitor air quality within NYU Abu Dhabi.
Configured the system on a Raspberry Pi using low-level frameworks to process environmental data.
Integrated real-time data alerts for users when air quality levels became hazardous.

projects.name: ChessBot
description: Prototyped a functional smart chessboard controlled through voice command in 3 months.
Assembled a linear motion system with an electromagnet to move pieces automatically.
Used Google Cloud’s Speech-to-Text API to interpret commands and trigger piece movement.
Awarded the Gunter Georgi Award for Outstanding Engineering Innovation at NYU.
